data.title: Reeves' war on 'blockers' and Southport 'fatal errors'
data.description: Rachel Reeves' plans for the economy and a report on failings in the Prevent programme lead the papers.

data.title: David Lammy 'horrified' after meeting Sudan war victims face-to-face
data.description: The UK foreign secretary urges the world not to forget Sudan after visiting those fleeing to Chad.

data.title: Ukraine claims drone strike on Russian oil refinery
data.description: Russia says it shot down more than 120 drones overnight, in what would be one of the largest attacks of the war.

data.title: Putin told to end 'ridiculous war' in Ukraine or face new sanctions
data.description: The US president says he is offering Moscow a "big favour" by helping Russia and Ukraine reach a deal.

data.title: Italy releases Libyan wanted for alleged war crimes
data.description: Italian authorities released the director of a notorious detention camp who had been arrested in Turin on an ICC war crimes warrant.

data.title: PM's terror law overhaul and Trump widens 'economic war'
data.description: Reforms after the Southport attacks and Donald Trump's threat to tax foreign nationals lead the papers.

data.title: 'A living hell': Sudanese women face rape and abuse in Libya
data.description: The BBC hears about horrific violence five women experienced in Libya after fleeing war-torn Sudan.

data.title: 'I want to fulfil my dead brother's dream' - rebuilding life in Gaza's ruins
data.description: The BBC's Fergal Keane has been speaking to people in Gaza whose lives have been devastated by the war.

data.title: Dramatic day ushers in a fragile Israel-Hamas ceasefire after 15 months of war
data.description: Three Israeli women hostages are released in Gaza, with 90 Palestinians set to be freed from Israeli jails in return.

data.title: How did we reach the Israel-Hamas ceasefire deal in Gaza?
data.description: The ceasefire agreement in the Gaza war follows 15 months of fighting between Israel and Hamas.

data.title: Photographer who 'inspired a generation' dies
data.description: Born in Coventry, John Blakemore became a key figure in post-war photography, experts say.

data.title: Ukraine launches largest attack of war so far, Kyiv claims
data.description: Officials in several Russian regions, some hundreds of kilometres from the border, reported strikes overnight.

data.title: Sudanese army claims capture of key eastern city from rebels
data.description: The development marks one of the most significant gains for the army in its almost two-year long war with rebel forces.

data.title: Warwick Davis to receive prestigious Bafta Fellowship
data.description: The actor is known for appearing in the Star Wars and Harry Potter films and presents game show Tenable.

data.title: Trump says meeting with Putin being arranged
data.description: The US president-elect has said previously that he wants to negotiate an end to the war in Ukraine.

data.title: Russia claims capture of Ukrainian front-line town
data.description: Ukraine has not acknowledged the fall of Kurakhove in the war-torn region of Donetsk.

data.title: The struggle to reunite children with families in war-torn Gaza
data.description: An estimated 17,000 children are unaccompanied or separated from family who would ordinarily care for them.

data.title: UN says Israeli attacks pushing Gaza healthcare towards total collapse
data.description: The UN rights office says the attacks raise serious concerns about war crimes and crimes against humanity.

data.title: An end to the war and lower food prices - what Russians want in 2025
data.description: People in Moscow speak to BBC Russia Editor Steve Rosenberg about their wishes for the New Year.

data.title: Russia and Ukraine exchange hundreds of prisoners of war
data.description: Moscow said 150 Russians were released while Zelensky said 189 Ukrainians had returned home.

data.title: Houthis vow to continue attacking Israel despite strikes on Yemen
data.description: An official says the Yemeni group will not stop until the war in Gaza ends, as Israel's PM says it is "just getting started".

data.title: 'Tears of joy' - Sudan capital gets first aid convoy since war began
data.description: In a breakthrough, trucks stacked with vital food supplies roll into war-hit Khartoum.

data.title: Ukraine captures injured North Korean soldier, says Seoul
data.description: The soldier is thought to be the first North Korean prisoner of war captured in the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

data.title: The Papers: 'Tory war with Farage' and Just Stop Oil 'hypocrites'
data.description: Friday's papers include stories on a clash of words between Nigel Farage and Kemi Badenoch.

data.title: Ukraine's war stamps put humour, patriotism and swearing in the post
data.description: Ukraine's war stamps, some with swear words, boost morale at home and promote its image abroad.

data.title: Slovak PM meets Putin in surprise Moscow visit
data.description: Robert Fico said he and the Russian leader discussed "the possibilities of an early, peaceful end of the war" in Ukraine.

data.title: Final black and white Doctor Who to air in colour
data.description: The War Games airs on Monday and has been colourised by a team led by Rich Tipple from Saltdean.

data.title: Last bone surgeon in northern Gaza killed, Palestinians say
data.description: Dr Sayeed Joudeh had come out of retirement to help during the war between Israel and Hamas.

data.title: Bloody siege ends Myanmar army control of western border
data.description: Insurgents seized Myanmar's border with Bangladesh in one of the bloodiest battles of the civil war.

data.title: Nato must switch to a wartime mindset, warns secretary general
data.description: Mark Rutte urged members to "turbocharge" their defence spending to prevent future war with Russia.

data.title: Inside Aleppo, the first city to fall to Syrian rebels
data.description: Residents of the the city that was ravaged by civil war seem keen to get rid of the symbols of the Assad regime.

data.title: 'Assad's fall means I can visit my mum's grave'
data.description: A Syrian refugee living in Lancashire says wars in his country meant he could not see his dying mother.

data.title: The global players in Syria before and after Assad
data.description: Global powers who have been involved in the 13-year civil war have a vested interest after Assad's fall.

data.title: China launches Nvidia probe as chip war rumbles on
data.description: It follows Washington's recent decision to further restrict sales to chip equipment makers in China.

data.title: Ukrainian war dead reaches 43,000, Zelensky says in rare update
data.description: The Ukrainian president also claimed that 198,000 Russian soldiers had been killed and 550,000 wounded.

data.title: Damascus in crosshairs as rebels continue lightning advance
data.description: The sudden offensive could become the biggest threat to Syria's president in 13 years of civil war.

data.title: 'Third nuclear age' threatens the West, armed forces chief warns
data.description: Only a "remote chance" Russia would directly attack the UK if the countries were at war, Admiral Radakin said.

data.title: Major war could destroy army in six months - minister
data.description: The defence minister said Russia was suffering 1,500 casualties a day in its conflict with Ukraine.

data.title: Inside Aleppo: Family reunions, nervousness at rebel rule and fear of war
data.description: Syria's second city has been captured by the armed rebel group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham from government forces.

data.title: Gazans displaced by war now face a new threat: winter
data.description: Palestinians displaced by the war are living on Gaza's coast, exposing them to harsh winter storms.

data.title: Zelensky suggests 'hot phase' of war could end if unoccupied Ukraine comes under Nato
data.description: But Zelensky points out no-one has yet made such an offer and whether Nato would consider a move is doubtful.

data.title: France admits colonial 'massacre', says Senegal's leader
data.description: Dozens - perhaps hundreds - of West African troops who fought for France in World War Two were killed.

data.title: Hangman of Nazi war criminal Adolf Eichmann dies
data.description: Shalom Nagar was chosen to hang one of the architects of the Holocaust, in Israel's only civil execution.

data.title: Russia ready to wage cyber war on UK, minister to say
data.description: Pat McFadden will tell a Nato conference that Russia could try to attack British businesses and power grids.

data.title: New weapons and nuclear risks: A week of change in Ukraine war
data.description: Russia made its loudest threat yet of nuclear war, as Western powers bolstered Ukraine's arsenal.

data.title: Biden says ICC war crimes arrest warrant 'outrageous'
data.description: US President Joe Biden calls the issuing of warrants against Israeli officials including Benjamin Netanyahu "outrageous".

data.title: ICC issues arrest warrants for Netanyahu, Gallant and Hamas commander
data.description: Judges found there were “reasonable grounds” they bore "criminal responsibility" for alleged war crimes and crimes against humanity.

data.title: Russia and US battle for advantage in Ukraine war ahead of Trump's return
data.description: Moscow appears to be maximising its gains while Joe Biden abandons long-held red lines at the end of his presidency.

data.title: The model, British tech and Russia's war machine
data.description: £1.6m of British kit shipped to companies tied to Russian military despite sanctions, customs documents claim.

data.title: Anti-landmine groups criticise US for sending mines to Ukraine
data.description: It marks a "shocking and devastating development" in the war, says Human Rights Watch.

data.title: Jihadist police chief of Timbuktu jailed for war crimes
data.description: Prosecutors say he led a "reign of terror" after the city was overrun by an al-Qaeda-linked group in 2012.

data.title: Zelensky says Ukraine will lose war if US cuts funding
data.description: US President-elect Donald Trump has campaigned on a promise to end America's involvement in wars.

data.title: Ukraine vows to 'never submit’ as war reaches 1,000th day
data.description: 'The Russian military will be punished,' Ukraine's foreign ministry says as it marks the milestone.

data.title: Turkish strikes in Syria cut water to one million people
data.description: The attacks have added to a humanitarian crisis in a region reeling from civil war and extreme drought.

data.title: Russia vows 'tangible' response if US missiles used against its territory
data.description: US approval for Ukraine to strike inside Russia is a key move in the war as it reaches its 1,000th day.

data.title: The Papers: PM 'defiant' on Ukraine and 'Clarkson's farmy army'
data.description: Fears of escalation in the Ukraine war and the UK farmer's protests feature on Tuesday's front pages.

data.title: Biden's move on missiles for Ukraine angers Trump allies
data.description: It is not clear if Biden's decision will be endorsed by Donald Trump who has promised to end the Ukraine war.

data.title: Can you fend for yourself? The advice given to people in Nordic nations in event of war
data.description: Sweden said the new advice follows a worsening security situation, by which it means the war in Ukraine.

data.title: How long-range missiles inside Russia could affect Ukraine war
data.description: The US has never allowed Kyiv to use long-range missiles for attacks inside Russia proper – until now.

data.title: Zelensky says war will 'end sooner' with Trump as president
data.description: The Ukrainian president also said his country "must do everything" to ensure the war ends next year.

data.title: HRW accuses Israel of war crime of forced displacement in Gaza
data.description: The rights group says the forced evacuation of 1.9m people amounts to a crime against humanity.

data.title: French weapons used in Sudan war despite UN arms embargo - Amnesty
data.description: French authorities have not commented while the UAE has previously denied arming the RSF.

data.title: Who is Elise Stefanik, Trump's pick for UN ambassador?
data.description: Stefanik has been critical of the UN for what she argues is a lack of sufficient support for Israel's war against Hamas.

data.title: Watch: Royals and veterans attend Cenotaph ceremony
data.description: King Charles led a two minutes of silence in remembrance of those who lost their lives in the two world wars and other conflicts.

data.title: Remembrance: Why do we wear poppies?
data.description: The poppy has been synonymous with marking Remembrance since a few years after World War One.

data.title: Students warned after Bonfire Night firework 'war'
data.description: Meanwhile, some students in Nottingham tell of their fears after the fireworks "war" on Bonfire Night.

data.title: Putin hails 'courageous' Trump after election win
data.description: The Russian president Putin also said that Trump's claim that he can help end the war in Ukraine "deserves attention at least".

data.title: Russian anti-war teenager faces five years in jail after failed appeal
data.description: Arseny Turbin, one of Russia's youngest political prisoners, has lost an appeal to overturn his five-year jail sentence.

data.title: Will Trump's victory spark a global trade war?
data.description: Trump has promised tariffs on all foreign goods. If he follows through, many smaller economies may be forced to respond in kind.

data.title: Israel's Netanyahu shows who calls the shots with Gallant sacking
data.description: The PM's decision to replace his defence minister follows sharp disagreements over Israel's war strategy.

data.title: 'We were laughing and talking with our WW1 enemies'
data.description: A nurse's scrapbook sheds new light on the famous World War One Christmas Truce.

data.title: Trump says Cheney wouldn’t be 'war hawk' if 'guns are trained on her'
data.description: Cheney, a former Republican congresswoman, has endorsed and campaigned on behalf of Kamala Harris.

data.title: The bear who was a private in the Polish army
data.description: The bear was enlisted into the Polish army and served alongside soldiers during World War Two.

data.title: Nato says North Korean troops deployed to Russia's Kursk region
data.description: Mark Rutte said the deployment represented a "dangerous expansion" of Russia's war in Ukraine.

data.title: Iran leader says Israeli attack should not be 'exaggerated or downplayed'
data.description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei refrained from pledging immediate retaliation while President Masoud Pezeshkian said Tehran did not seek war.

data.title: BBC correspondent: I fled Gaza but I'm overwhelmed by guilt about family still there
data.description: The BBC's Gaza correspondent is among the Palestinians who have fled their home since the war began.

data.title: Gaza war's 'darkest moment' unfolding in north, UN says
data.description: Volker Türk has called on world leaders to act, saying states had a duty to ensure respect for international humanitarian law.

data.title: Zelensky snubs UN chief Guterres after his Russia trip
data.description: A source in Ukraine's presidency tells the BBC that António Guterres shook hands with "war instigator" Vladimir Putin.

data.title: Ex-rebel gets 40-year jail term in landmark Ugandan case
data.description: Thomas Kwoyelo is the first member of the feared Lord's Resistance Army to be tried for war crimes in Uganda.

data.title: North Korea troops in Ukraine would escalate conflict, Lukashenko tells BBC
data.description: Vladimir Putin's closest ally speaks to Steve Rosenberg about the war, nuclear weapons and relations with the West.

data.title: 'War, sadness and stagnation' - the fans following a homeless team
data.description: Shakhtar Donetsk fans congregate in London for their Champions League game against Arsenal, the first away sell-out they have had in 10 years of exile.

data.title: PM says Russia risks global food security in Ukraine
data.description: Despite the war, Ukraine is still a significant supplier of agricultural goods including grain.

data.title: US swing state voters: 'You have a big say on what happens in the entire world'
data.description: Residents in key states describe constant ads, neighbourhood sign wars and high anxiety ahead of the 2024 election.

data.title: Son charged with murdering war photographer father
data.description: British photojournalist Paul Lowe was found fatally stabbed on a hiking trail in California.

data.title: 105-year-old war hero who has Facebook and scans share prices like a city trader
data.description: Tony Johnson lives independently at his Greater Manchester home and scours share prices daily like a city trader.

data.title: Devastating setback for evacuated Gaza teen after surgery
data.description: The ongoing Israel-Hamas war broke out 12 days before the girl was to receive treatment in Jerusalem.

data.title: Religious hate crime at record high, figures show
data.description: The Israel-Hamas war has led to an increase in antisemitic and Islamophobic incidents, the Home Office says.

data.title: Hospitals move patients as Israeli tanks encircle Jabalia camp
data.description: The Israeli military is carrying out its third ground offensive in the area since the Gaza war began.

data.title: Falklands and Gibraltar will stay British, PM says
data.description: The prime minister said the issue was "personal" because his uncle nearly died in the 1982 Falklands war.

data.title: EU to vote on import taxes on Chinese electric cars
data.description: The vote risks sparking a trade war as the EU looks to protect its own car makers.
